text: The National Enquirer is an American tabloid newspaper. It was founded in 1926. The National Enquirer openly admits that it pays sources for tips. This is a common practice in tabloid journalism that results in conflicts of interest. It has also been in several controversies related to its catch and kill allegations of blackmail. Due to competition from other tabloid publications, it has sold fewer copies. ==References== Category:1926 establishments in the United States Category:Newspapers in New York City
title: National Enquirer
